title: FOIL: Procedures for handling removal of school officers by NYSED Commissioner (Sole Supervisory District Of Nassau County And Boces)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All materials related to processes that would need to take place if the Commissioner of Education of the State of New York removes one, multiple or all board members, school officers or superintendents from a school district under the jurisdiction of  your sole supervisory district (your organization). Specifically, I request any and all materials including, but not limited to:

1) Policies, procedures, and protocols for responding to the removal of board members, school officers or superintendents, including but not limited to filling vacancies and ensuring continuity of school district operations.

2) Records of any past instances where the Commissioner of Education has removed board members, school officers or superintendents from school districts under the jurisdiction of your sole supervisory district (your organization) and the actions taken by the sole supervisory district (your organization) or NYSED in response.

3) Any other records or materials relevant to the processes that would need to take place if the Commissioner of Education removes one, multiple or all board members, school officers or superintendents from a school district under the jurisdiction of the sole supervisory district (your organization).

Please provide any records or materials that are responsive to this request, regardless of format or medium. If some records are not subject to disclosure, please provide the reasons for the denial of access.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Polk County Sheriff's Office (Florida) Social Media

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Polk County Sheriff's Office (Florida) Social Media
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks records relating to the Facebook page located at https://www.facebook.com/polkcountysheriff. An example of what each of these records look like is available at https://bit.ly/facebookfoia.

In order to access the requested information, you will first need to take the following steps:

1. Log into the page account or a Facebook account with managerial access to the Facebook page. For information on this type of access, see: https://www.facebook.com/help/187316341316631.)
2. "Switch" to the page account. To do so, click your profile photo in the top right, then click "See all profiles", then select the Page you want to switch into. (See the instructions here: https://www.facebook.com/help/123930246348340).
3. Click "Professional dashboard" on the left, or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/polkcountysheriff/?sk=professional_dashboard

I request the following information:

1. The "Page and Tagging" information. Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=timeline&privacy_source=timeline_gear_menu.

2. The list of blocked users. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block users"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

3. The list of blocked Pages. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block Pages"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

4. The list of "Moderation Assist" criteria. This information is accessible by following either of these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard" and then click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen.
(b) Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/polkcountysheriff/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist

5. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has certain keywords", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has certain keywords").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has certain keywords"
(d) On the right side of the "Keywords" menu, click the ellipsis menu ("...")
(e) Click "Copy list" from the dropdown menu.
(f) Provide the information from the list.

6. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has specific links", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has specific links").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has links to specific sites."
(d) Provide the information from the "Added sites" list.

7. The list of people with Facebook access. From the "Professional dashboard" page (https://www.facebook.com/polkcountysheriff/?sk=professional_dashboard), click "Page Access" on the left side of the screen. Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=profile_access

8. The list of moderation actions in the Activity log. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard."
(b) Click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/polkcountysheriff/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist).
(c) Click "Activity log" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/polkcountysheriff/professional_dashboard/moderation_activity_log).
(c) From the dropdown menu labeled "Visible comments", select "Hidden comments".
(d) Continue scrolling down until the complete list is loaded.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking access to any and all bodycam footage related to the following incident:

Incident# 2301220136/Case# 23001556

I am particularly interested in obtaining any footage captured by the body-worn cameras of officers or deputies who responded to the incident.

As a member of the public, I believe that I have a right to access these records under the Florida Public Records Law. Therefore, I request that you provide access to the requested records as soon as possible and within the statutory time frame of 10 business days.

I am also requesting that you waive any fees associated with this request, as I am a member of the public and this request is being made for a public purpose.

I understand that your agency may charge a fee for the actual cost of duplication or retrieval of records, but I respectfully request that you waive any such fees in the interest of transparency and public access.

title: Swatting (Massachusetts State Police)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Swatting (Massachusetts State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Internal memos, directives, and communications regarding false reports of active shooters or bomb threats in the state since 09/01/2021
- Any bulletins sent to local police or schools regarding  false reports of active shooters or bomb threats in the state since 09/01/2021
- Any investigative reports regarding  false reports of active shooters or bomb threats in the state since 09/01/2021

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a public records request. 

Please provide all text or chat messages in any form or application (SMS, MMS, WhatsApp, WeChat, Signal, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, Hangouts, Skype, Teams) sent to OR form Chief Scott and any of the following:

Mayor Breed or any of her staff
Sam Dodge
DEM Director Carroll
Carla Short
Jeff Kositsky
Lena Miller
Matt Dorsey of any of his staff
Joel Engardio or any of his staff
Rafael Mandelman or any of his staff
Catherine Stefani or any of her staff

between the dates of Jan 1, 2023 and April 10, 2023 (inclusive), including a personal search under City of San Jose vs Superior Court (2017). Please also include any group messages. While the phone numbers are not needed, the following must be preserved: the timestamps, the textual content, attachments, and images, and also ALL sender and recipient names (including groups). Pursuant to SF Admin Code 67.21(l), please provide a spreadsheet format or if you will use PDF, do not print and scan.

Provide results on a rolling basis.

Do not destroy or discard any responsive records - we will appeal all withholdings or Sunshine violations.

Thank you for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

title: Chester Fire Department Call Sheets, Participation Reports, and Truck Checks

communications.subject: New Hampshire Right to Know Law Request: Chester Fire Department Call Sheets, Participation Reports, and Truck Checks
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records of the Chester Fire Department:

CALL SHEETS AND CORRESPONDING DISPATCH TIMES
The two sided Call Sheets and Dispatch Times for all calls for service between January 1, 2021 and April 1, 2023. Each Call Sheet includes a list of Fire Department employees at the time of the call, member certifications, what members responded to the call, the response role of each member, the staffing of each apparatus that responded, and the total members that responded to the call. The back side of the call sheet may also include a brief handwritten 1-2 sentence description of the call and the actions taken by the Fire Department. Each Call Sheet has a corresponding Dispatch Times sheet provided by Derry Fire Alarm showing the details of the call (address, determinant level for EMS calls, units responding, and the times of each unit responding). It is believed that these records are located at the Chester Fire Department and are believed to be contained within 3-ring binders with each Dispatch Times Sheet stored together with the corresponding Call Sheet.

This request does NOT include official incident reports created by the Chester Fire Department and submitted to NFIRS.  

PARTICIPATION REPORTS
Chester Fire Department participation reports from January 1, 2021 to March 31, 2023 (including the quarterly report JAN-2023 through MAR-2023). These reports are kept in Office Manager Ingalls office on the wall immediately to the left of the door. These reports list the call, training, and combined participation percentages of every member on a monthly and quarterly basis. These reports show the participation of employees acting in their official capacities as municipal employees and provide insight into the efficiency/effectiveness of the Department and inform the public of the staffing level regularly available for emergency calls.

TRUCK CHECK SHEETS
Truck Check sheets for all apparatus (Rescue 1, Engine 1, Engine 2, Tank 1, Utility 1, Forestry 1, Forestry 2, and Car 1) from January 1, 2023 through April 1, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. The purpose of this request is to obtain the data necessary to generate statistics in aggregate concerning the staffing/certification level over a period of time and the availability of resources for emergencies. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin J Dolan

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

title: Migrants deaths and remains found

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Migrants deaths and remains found
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. Specifically, I am seeking access to the following information regarding migrant remains that have been documented in your Medical Examiner Officer or Yuma County Sheriff's files for fiscal years 2017 - 2022:

Age
Sex
Body condition
Coordinates where the body was located
Country of origin
Cause of death
I understand that these records may contain sensitive information, and I assure you that any information provided will be used solely for legitimate research purposes.

Please inform me of any fees associated with this request, and I would be happy to provide payment if necessary. Additionally, please let me know if there are any limitations on the amount of information that can be provided, or if you require any further information from me in order to process this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gabriela Villegas
